intro: Mikania vargasii, commonly known as the Mexican vine, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly serrated edge. Mikania vargasii is often found in moist, shaded areas and can be invasive in certain regions.
